items.title: Mapping India’s ecommerce standouts
items.summary:
- This landscape map provides an overview of key players in India’s ecommerce sector.
- Highlights active backers and investment trends in the ecommerce vertical.
- For more landscape reports, visit [Tech in Asia](https://www.techinasia.com/category/landscape-reports).

items.title: Taiwan approves investment plans from local Google, Amazon units
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) has approved investment plans from Google, Amazon, and TSMC.
- Google Engineering UK Holdings to invest NT$7 billion (US$211.3 million) in research for mobile and wearable technology in Taiwan.
- Amazon's A100 Row Inc. is authorized for NT$2.59 billion (US$87.2 million) investment in AWS Taiwan for personnel costs and equipment maintenance.
- TSMC's US$10 billion outbound investment to TSMC Global in the British Virgin Islands also approved by MOEA.

items.title: Ubisoft creates $4.3b unit to oversee key franchises
items.summary:
- Ubisoft Entertainment SA has launched a new subsidiary to manage key franchises like Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, and Rainbow Six.
- The subsidiary is valued at roughly €4 billion (US$4.3 billion), with Tencent acquiring a 25% stake for €1.16 billion (US$1.25 billion).
- The deal aims to reduce Ubisoft’s debt and support other franchises, expected to close by the end of 2025.

items.title: Meta’s Asia-Pacific head Dan Neary steps down after 12 years
items.summary:
- Dan Neary is leaving Meta after 12 years as the Asia-Pacific head.
- His departure is for personal reasons, and he will assist in the transition process over the next several months.
- Neary joined Meta (formerly Facebook) in 2013 and played a key role in expanding its market presence in Australia, Greater China, and Southeast Asia.
- Significant growth in user bases and ad revenue occurred during his tenure.
- Prior to Meta, Neary worked at Skype and eBay.
- His departure aligns with Meta's increased focus on AI developments.

items.title: UK regulator fines OnlyFans $1.4m for age verification failures
items.summary:
- Ofcom fined Fenix International Limited £1.05 million (US$1.4 million) for age verification inaccuracies.
- The company misreported its “challenger age” threshold as 23 years, when it was actually set at 20.
- OnlyFans adjusted its age threshold to 23 years in January 2025, then lowered it to 21.
- Ofcom’s enforcement director stated the importance of accurate information for regulatory oversight.
- OnlyFans confirmed the investigation's resolution and emphasized compliance commitment.

items.title: Indian gov’t to launch new taxi service to rival Ola, Uber
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The Indian government is launching a new taxi service named “Sahkar Taxi” to compete with Ola and Uber.
- The service will include two-wheeler taxis, auto-rickshaws, and four-wheeler taxis.
- Union Home Minister Amit Shah emphasized that the service allows drivers to earn directly without sharing profits with larger companies.
- Sahkar Taxi is expected to roll out nationwide in the coming months.
- The initiative is inspired by previous models like West Bengal’s “Yatri Sathi” program.

items.title: Unlocking SEA’s investment potential
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's digital economy's gross merchandise value (GMV) reached US$263 billion in 2024, growing 15% year-on-year.
- Key sectors driving economic growth include ecommerce, fintech, AI, and cleantech, with substantial investments expected to continue.
- The region's ecommerce sector showed a 15% growth, significantly aided by video commerce.
- Fintech innovation is growing with the popularity of digital payments and lending platforms like Funding Societies and Amartha.
- Over US$30 billion was invested in AI infrastructure in the first half of 2024, highlighting the sector's growth potential.
- Southeast Asia's net zero ambition faces challenges but also presents opportunities in renewable energy and sustainable technologies.
- Investors should focus on adaptable strategies amid shifting conditions, sustainable growth, and diverse regulatory environments.

items.title: Nvidia backs CoreWeave IPO at $40 per share, source says
items.summary:
- Nvidia is backing CoreWeave’s IPO with a US$250 million order at US$40 per share.
- The IPO was initially priced between US$47 and US$55 per share, but CoreWeave will not adjust or refile.
- Nvidia owns about 6% of CoreWeave; both Nvidia and CoreWeave declined to comment on the matter.
- The IPO occurs during a market slowdown, influenced by inflation, interest rates, and global trade tensions.

items.title: India’s Jio Financial invests $117m in its lending arm
items.summary:
- Jio Financial Services invests ₹1,000.24 crore (US$117 million) into Jio Finance Limited (JFL).
- The investment was announced on March 27, consisting of 1.73 crore equity shares priced at ₹10 (US$0.12) each.
- JFL, formerly Reliance Retail Ventures Limited, changed its name in August 2023 and provides various financial services, including home loans.

items.title: Supercharge your growth in 4 hours
items.summary:
- AMPED, a new event series, offers a four-hour experience with local tips and hands-on activities.
- The first event is scheduled for June 11, 2025, in Malaysia, focusing on scaling strategies, practical skills, and networking.
- Malaysia is poised as a tech hub in Southeast Asia, providing opportunities for startups and investors.
- Early bird tickets are available for US$40 until April 11, 2025, or until sold out.

items.title: Chinese cloud market to grow 15% in 2025
items.author: Rachel Brindley
items.summary:
- Cloud infrastructure spending in mainland China is projected to grow by 15% in 2025, reaching US$46 billion according to a report by Canalys.
- There was a 13% increase in 2024, driven by the adoption of AI technologies.
- Launch of AI foundation models like DeepSeek’s R1 has promoted enterprise AI adoption, changing performance and cost benchmarks.
- Major cloud providers including Alibaba, Huawei, and Tencent are expanding investments in computing resources and AI infrastructure.
- Alibaba, holding a 36% market share in Q4 2024, plans to invest 380 billion yuan (US$52.4 billion) over the next three years.

items.title: WhatsApp gains EU court support in privacy fine dispute
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- WhatsApp received support from the EU court regarding a privacy fine dispute.
- The ruling could have implications for data protection regulations.
- The case highlighted tensions between tech companies and EU privacy laws.

items.title: Google adds AI tools to Maps, Search, Hotels for travel
items.summary:
- Google enhances travel planning with updates to Maps, Search, and Hotels.
- New Google Maps feature lets users identify and save locations from screenshots using Gemini AI, available to iOS users in the US this week.
- Google Search now provides itinerary-building tools for customized trip plans, with options to save to Google Maps or export to Google Docs or Gmail.
- AI Overviews in Google Lens now support six additional languages, including Hindi and Spanish.
- Global rollout of price drop alerts for hotels allows users to monitor prices and receive email notifications on changes.

items.title: IBM spinoff Kyndryl falls 11% on fraud allegations
items.summary:
- Shares of Kyndryl dropped over 11% on Mar. 27 due to allegations from short-seller Gotham City regarding financial manipulation.
- Report claims the company altered metrics to appear profitable despite ongoing losses and cash burn.
- Kyndryl’s revenue has declined year over year, with more accurate calculations showing negative cash flow.
- Rising costs related to IBM could increase by $1 to $2 billion in the coming years.
- Allegations include accounting and disclosure irregularities concerning payments to IBM from 2019 to 2023.
- Kyndryl, spun off from IBM, has not responded to these allegations.

items.title: Amazon Fresh expands to 170 cities in India
items.summary:
- Amazon Fresh has expanded its grocery delivery service to over 170 cities in India.
- The service grew from 130 locations and now includes tier-II and tier-III cities like Gorakhpur, Chittoor, Ambala, and Vijayawada.
- The company reported a 50% year-on-year growth in operations for Amazon Fresh during the second half of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023.
- Offers various grocery items such as fruits, vegetables, dairy products, frozen goods, and personal care items with deliveries made within a two-hour window.

items.title: Who’s investing in India’s biotech startups?
US AI security startup Hakimo nets $10.5m series A
items.author: Sam Joseph, Sagar Honnungar
items.summary:
- Hakimo, a California-based startup, raised $10.5 million in a Series A funding round.
- The funding round was led by Vertex Ventures and Zigg Capital, with contributions from RXR Arden Digital Ventures and existing investors.
- This brings Hakimo's total funding to $20.5 million.
- The funds will enhance their AI-driven security solutions.
- Hakimo was founded in 2020 to tackle issues in the security industry, specifically staffing shortages and false alarms.

items.title: TikTok Shop expands in Europe as US future remains unclear
items.summary:
- TikTok Shop, the ecommerce branch of TikTok, will expand to France, Germany, and Italy on March 31.
- The expansion aims to onboard more local sellers and enhance product offerings, with Carrefour in France and AboutYou and Cosnova in Germany.
- TikTok Shop plans to offer high-end products, including second-hand Birkin bags, alongside discounted items.
- Merchants in the new markets are already listing products ahead of the launch.
- The rollout in Europe is expected to be faster than in the UK due to prior experience.
- The expansion occurs amidst scrutiny in the US, where TikTok may face restrictions unless ByteDance divests its American business.

items.title: US AI startup Yutori raises $15m funding
items.author: Devi Parikh, Dhruv Batra, Rob Toews, Fei-Fei Li, Jeff Dean
items.summary:
- Yutori raises $15 million in funding for AI-powered personal assistants.
- Funding round announced on March 27, 2025, led by Rob Toews from Radical Ventures.
- Participants include Felicis, AI expert Fei-Fei Li, and Google DeepMind chief scientist Jeff Dean.
- Co-founded by former Meta executives Devi Parikh and Dhruv Batra, experts in AI research.
- Focus on refining AI models through post-training to enhance performance on specific tasks.

items.title: Amazon tests rebranding Echo devices as Alexa
items.summary:
- Amazon is experimenting with rebranding Echo devices as Alexa devices.
- Products like the Echo Show 5 were briefly labeled as Alexa Show 5 on Amazon.
- Amazon spokesperson confirmed the test, aiming to understand customer perceptions.
- The rebranding trial coincides with the anticipated launch of a new version called Alexa Plus.
- By March 27, references to Alexa-branded products were removed from Amazon pages, indicating a limited trial.

items.title: ByteDance pressures US team as TikTok Shop falls short
items.summary:
- ByteDance is increasing pressure on its US e-commerce team after TikTok Shop missed its 2024 sales target of $17 billion.
- Bob Kang, head of e-commerce, addressed performance concerns in a global meeting, confirmed by attendees.
- Leadership may have misjudged US consumer behavior, hindering the replication of Douyin's success.
- Stricter workplace policies are now in place, requiring in-office work five days a week.
- Performance evaluations have tightened, leading to low scores and potential severance for some employees.
- A strategic shift is underway, with TikTok moving from livestream shopping to short videos to better fit the US market.

items.title: Charting Vietnam’s fintech terrain under evolving regulations
items.summary:
- Vietnam experienced a 50% increase in non-cash payment volume in 2023, with rapid growth continuing into 2024.
- The rise of QR code payments, particularly through VietQR, has impacted digital wallets like MoMo and ZaloPay.
- In 2024, Vietnamese fintech companies raised less than US$1 million, a sharp decline from US$474 million in 2021.
- Companies are diversifying services and adopting super-app strategies to remain competitive.
- Airwallex's acquisition of CTIN Pay highlights the opportunity for foreign investment in Vietnam’s fintech market.
- Regulatory challenges are increasing for fintech firms, impacting their operational strategies.

items.title: Fintech platform for Indian-Americans bags $14m seed funding
items.summary:
- A fintech platform catering to Indian-Americans has successfully raised $14 million in seed funding.
- The funding aims to further develop the platform's services and expand its reach.
- This investment highlights the growing interest in fintech solutions tailored for specific community needs.

items.title: The VCs’ guide to keeping LPs happy
These are the most active investors in Hong Kong’s startups
items.summary:
- List of active investors in Hong Kong startups based on deals made in the past 12 months.
- Focus on firms that have invested in three or more companies in this timeframe.
- The data is continually updated, and corrections are welcomed via email to Tech in Asia.

items.title: Intel, Dell-backed AI startup appoints new CTO
Indian SaaS firm JungleWorks acquires sales engagement platform
items.summary:
- Indian SaaS company JungleWorks has acquired a sales engagement platform.
- This acquisition aims to enhance JungleWorks' capabilities in the sales domain.
- The deal highlights the growing interest in SaaS solutions in the Indian market.
- The specific financial terms of the acquisition have not been disclosed.

items.title: Alibaba open-sources multimodal AI Qwen2.5-Omni-7B
items.summary:
- Alibaba has released Qwen2.5-Omni-7B, its first multimodal LLM that processes text, images, audio, and video simultaneously.
- The model generates outputs in both text and natural-sounding speech in real time.
- In benchmark tests like OmniBench, it outperformed models such as Google’s Gemini 1.5 Pro.
- Qwen2.5-Omni-7B can interpret multiple sensory inputs and respond to complex tasks effectively.

items.title: Foxconn to outline EV strategy in Japan
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Foxconn will hold a seminar in Japan on April 9 to discuss its EV strategy.
- The seminar aims to provide insights to Japanese automakers and suppliers, with Jun Seki, Foxconn's chief EV strategy officer, expected to speak.
- This follows Foxconn's agreement with Mitsubishi Motors to produce EVs for Oceania, marking its first outsourcing deal with a Japanese automaker in response to competition from Chinese EV firms.

items.title: SK Hynix reports surge in demand before tariffs
Animoca’s Yat Siu doubles down on Web3 while others pull back
Chinese robotics firm Unitree eyes expansion as demand surges
Trump may cut China tariffs to secure TikTok deal
OpenAI nears $40b funding round led by SoftBank
Apple names new vice president of global retail
Nvidia nears acquisition of AI server firm Lepton AI
Kim Jong Un tests AI suicide drones for military modernization
items.summary:
- North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw tests of AI-equipped suicide drones.
- State media emphasized the significance of unmanned systems and AI in arms development.
- Upgraded reconnaissance drones can detect tactical targets and monitor enemy activities.
- North Korea revealed an airborne early-warning aircraft for the first time.
- Kim highlighted the necessity of unmanned equipment and AI for military modernization.

items.title: Blibli posts 14% revenue growth in 2024
items.summary:
- Blibli reported a 14% year-on-year increase in consolidated net revenue for 2024, with a 41% surge in Q4.
- Direct sales business grew 66% to 859 billion rupiah (US$51.89 million) and marketplace sales rose 26%.
- Gross profit increased 173% year-on-year, and operational take rate rose to 6.9%.
- The company expanded its logistics network enabling two-hour delivery in 48 cities and operates 204 consumer electronics stores, 60 premium supermarkets, and 32 home and living centers.
- Initiatives supported by a 2.25 trillion rupiah (US$135.93 million) capital raise, reducing operating losses by 34%.

items.title: BYD targets 800k overseas EV sales by 2025
items.summary:
- BYD aims to double its overseas EV sales to over 800,000 units by 2025, announced by chairman Wang Chuanfu on Mar. 25.
- The company plans local vehicle assembly to mitigate tariff challenges while sourcing components from China.
- BYD is expanding in Latin America, Southeast Asia, and Britain, but will not enter the US or Canada due to tariffs.
- New factories are being constructed in Brazil, Thailand, Hungary, and Turkey.
- Overseas markets are expected to be a key driver for BYD's profitability, prompting a planned increase in its software team from 5,000 to 8,000 employees.

items.title: Ex-Intel CEO joins venture capital firm Playground Global
items.summary:
- Former Intel CEO, Brian Krzanich, has joined Playground Global, a venture capital firm focused on technology investments.
- Playground Global aims to support startups in hardware and AI sectors.
- Krzanich's experience in the tech industry is expected to enhance the firm's investment strategy.

items.title: Tesla stock drops 6% on Europe sales slump
items.summary:
- Tesla’s stock fell by 6% on Mar. 26, 2025, due to decreased sales in Europe and concerns over US auto tariffs.
- In February, Tesla experienced a 40% drop in new vehicle registrations in Europe while overall battery EV sales increased by 26%.
- The White House announced upcoming auto tariffs, which may impact foreign automakers.

items.title: Indian B2B ecommerce firm Jumbotail buys SC Ventures’ Solv India
items.summary:
- SC Ventures sells Solv India to Jumbotail, pending regulatory approvals.
- The merger aims to combine Jumbotail’s food and grocery ecommerce focus with Solv India’s apparel, home furnishings, footwear, and toys offerings.
- Jumbotail, established in 2015, provides ecommerce solutions for small retailers.
- Solv India, incubated in 2019, offers a digital commerce and supply chain finance platform for MSMEs.

items.title: Ticket resale firm StubHub omits co-founder in IPO filing
items.summary:
- StubHub filed for an IPO without mentioning its co-founder, Jeff Fluhr.
- The omission of Fluhr raises questions about his role and contributions to the company.
- StubHub is a major player in the ticket resale market, significantly impacting the industry.

items.title: Lazada ID co-founder’s healthtech startup raises $12m series B
items.author: Sundeep Sahni, Nadine Karadag, Ankur Majumder
items.summary:
- Valeo Health raises US$12 million in its series B funding round.
- Total funding for Valeo now reaches US$20 million.
- Series B led by Flintera; existing investors including Nuwa Capital, FJ Labs, Oryx, and Mindshift Capital, with new investors Oraseya and Eirad participating.
- Funds will be used to expand services in Saudi Arabia, UAE, and other GCC countries.
- Valeo provides AI-driven personalized healthcare and at-home services.

items.title: Chinese AI firm SenseTime posts $592m loss
items.summary:
- SenseTime Group Inc. reported a net loss of 4.3 billion yuan (US$592 million) for 2024, exceeding analyst estimates.
- Revenue grew by 11% to 3.8 billion yuan (US$523 million), driven by the generative AI segment, but fell short of the 4.5 billion yuan projected.
- The company plans to reduce costs related to large model training in anticipation of growth in large model applications.
- Recent developments include integrating DeepSeek into SenseCore and spinning off its AI medical unit.

items.title: AMPED Malaysia
items.summary:
- The article discusses the AMPED Malaysia event which focuses on technology and entrepreneurship in Malaysia.
- It highlights key speakers, workshops, and networking opportunities available during the event.
- The event aims to foster collaboration and innovation within the Malaysian tech community.

items.title: D2C tea brand Vahdam India raises $3m
items.author: Bala Sarda
items.summary:
- Vahdam India raised 25 crore rupees (US$3 million) from SIDBI Venture Capital.
- The investment is stated to be 'strategic' and not part of a formal fundraising round.
- Founded in 2015, Vahdam sources tea from partner farmers across India and processes it locally.
- The company operates in international markets including the US, Canada, UK, and Europe through wholly owned subsidiaries.

items.title: Grab Malaysia partners with EV firms to boost driver adoption
items.summary:
- Grab Malaysia signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with BYD Sime Motors, Yinson Green Technologies (M), and Power-Up Tech to promote electric vehicle (EV) adoption among driver-partners.
- The initiative aims to provide accessible EV solutions and support Malaysia’s sustainability goals, including developing necessary charging infrastructure.
- BYD Sime Motors will offer exclusive car pricing and training, Yinson GreenTech will provide preferential leasing and charging rates, while Power-Up Tech will ensure reliable charging infrastructure through mobile charging facilities.

items.title: UAE-based AI startup Lumi bags $3.7m seed funding
items.author: Ibrahim Ashqar, Tudor Boiangiu
items.summary:
- Lumi AI, a UAE-based startup, raised $3.7 million in seed funding led by AgFunder, with investors including ADQ and Forum Ventures.
- This is Lumi AI's second funding round after an earlier investment in August 2023.
- Founded in April 2023, Lumi AI offers generative AI tools to help retail businesses digitize supply chains.
- The company plans to expand its conversational analytics platform and enhance its engineering and customer success teams.

items.title: X to grow ad revenue by 17.5% in 2025
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s X (formerly Twitter) is projected to achieve a 17.5% increase in US advertising revenue in 2025, reaching US$1.31 billion.
- Global ad sales for 2025 are expected to rise 16.5% to US$2.26 billion.
- Despite this growth, X’s advertising revenue is significantly lower than the US$4.5 billion reported in 2021 before Musk's acquisition.
